intro: Anthospermum ciliare var. glabrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, with a slight pubescence on the underside. This variant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
